events.name: FCL Lunch Talk: Bandung’s contemporary public spaces
events.description:
BANDUNG’S CONTEMPORARY PUBLIC SPACES
Florian & Daliana from SHAU –an architecture firm based in Bandung, Munich, and Rotterdam – will present their public space designs for Bandung. SHAU has been taking part in the city’s new development under the visionary mayor Ridwan Kamil. It started with the Film Park under the Pasupati highway, continued with a series of Microlibraries –from Microlibrary Bima with 2000 reused ice cream buckets to the one with moss ceilings and edible plants – and Alun Alun Cicendo ‘Steel Plaza’ which is a redefinition of the traditional alun alun square typology in a contemporary format. Designing for Indonesia is an adventure which allows a certain kind of experimentation unfamiliar to the European context.


SHAU
SHAU is an architecture studio founded by Daliana Suryawinata (ID), Florian Heinzelmann (DE) and Tobias Hofmann (DE) in 2009 in Rotterdam (Netherlands), Munich (Germany) and Bandung (ID) which they expanded in April 2015. Their aim is to design attractive buildings and cities which are socially and environmentally responsible. Some of SHAU’s achievements include the 2017’s WAFX Smart Cities award from the World Architecture Festival, Small Firm of the Year in Sustainable Architecture from the American Architecture Prize, Architizer Jury and Public Choice A+ Award in Community and Architecture category, and recently the Silver Prize from Lafarge Holcim Award Asia-Pacific.
 
Florian Heinzelmann Dipl.-Ing. (FH), M. Arch., SBA 
Florian received his Diplom Ingenieur (FH) degree in Architecture from Munich University of Applied Sciences where he and Tobias Hofmann received an Archiprix award; and a post graduate degree from the Berlage Institute, Rotterdam. Florian has worked for UNStudio, Amsterdam, most notably as a project leader for the Fraunhofer Institute project - Center of Virtual Engineering (ZVE) in Stuttgart, which received a Gold certificate of the German Sustainable Building Council DGNB. Florian is finalizing his PhD research on Adaptive Daylight Systems in large roofs under Prof.Dr.-Ing. Patrick Teuffel (TU Delft and TU Eindhoven). In 2009 together with Tobias Hofmann and Daliana Suryawinata, he set up SHAU. Florian has received several grants and is regularly lecturing at Universities, speaking on conferences and publishing research papers & articles. 
 
Daliana Suryawinata B. Sc., M. Arch., IAI
Daliana studied architecture in Jakarta, Indonesia and obtained a post graduate degree at the Berlage Institute in Rotterdam in 2005. Her earlier working experience includes andramatin architects and Han Awal and Partners. She was a member of Arsitek Muda Indonesia in 2001-2002. After her studies, she worked as an architect for OMA, MVRDV and West8 in Rotterdam. Daliana has taught master courses at The Why Factory at TU Delft and the Berlage Institute. In 2009 she was a local curator for the 4th International Architecture Biennale Rotterdam with Prof Stephen Cairns. Daliana is a board member of the Indonesian Diaspora Foundation based in Washington. She also founded the Liveable Cities Taskforce at the Indonesian Diaspora Network. Together with former minister Mari Pangestu, architect Diana Ang and art manager Windi Salomo, she co-organized Kota Tua Creative Festival 2014.
events.location: Value Lab Asia, Singapore-ETH Centre, #06-01, CREATE Tower, 1 Create Way, Singapore 138602

events.name: Fast and Modern SSL: Lunch & Learn
events.description:
Fast and Modern SSL: What you need to know to keep your SSL fast and compatible in the next 6 months:

SPDY or HTTP/2
Goodbye SHA1 and RC4, Hello elliptic curves and SNI support
New School OCSP Stapling vs. Old School CRLs
Why you need TLS Session Resumption
Is TLS 1.3 worth it?

Trey Guinn is visiting from San Francisco and wants to give an opportunity to connect with the Singapore community. Join him for lunch and a learn from his talk on SSL. 
About the Speaker:
Trey Guinn leads the enterprise solution engineering group at Cloudflare where he works with large customers to help them to manage their network edge. His work focuses on TLS, DDoS Mitigation, Web Application Firewalls, HTTP, and DNS. Trey has worked in internet application delivery for over 15 years in small and large companies in several countries - from multinationals like KPMG to one room startups. Security is a continual focus of his career (as it should be for every engineer) with work ranging from network security to identify management.
Agenda: 
12:15pm: Doors open, lunch & networking
12:30pm: Talk kickoff
1:30pm: Event conclusion
events.location: Cloudflare - Singapore, 120 Robinson Road, #15-01 (McCallum Street), Singapore 068913

events.name: Quantum computing meetup
events.description: Hello Quantumers! Our fourth Meetup is on Wednesday May 16th from 6:30 - 9:00pm, and it will be located at WeWork Beach Centre, 15 Beach Road. City Hall, Esplanade, and Bugis MRT stations are all 5 minutes walk away. The folks at WeWork have been very kind to offer us an amazing meeting room for the meetup, and access to their shared utilities. We have two introductory talks scheduled for the event. First, Professor Joseph Fitzsimons (NUS, SUTD), will give a brief introduction to quantum computing. This will be followed by a discussion of the current industrial landscape in quantum computing, by Dr Ewan Munro, CTO of Entropica Labs. Each talk will last for 20 minutes, followed by a Q&A and a networking session. Directions: Entrance to Beach Centre is located on Beach Road and Seah Street. WeWork's lobby is located on the 2nd floor. Upon arrival, please check in on the visitor kiosk via the Guest Registration Tablet at the Front Desk noting you are a guest of Jackie Lam.
events.location: WeWork Beach Centre, Singapore, WeWork Beach Centre, 15 Beach Road

events.name: Threat Hunting for non-security folks & Old Skool Copy Protection
events.description: We are excited to announce this month Meetup Agenda • Networking and Snacks • Introduction & Announcements • Threat Hunting for non-security folks - by Michael RebultanAbstract: Security is everyone’s concern and you cannot simply rely on the traditional antivirus that is installed in your system as almost 70% of malware misses by the tool for the first hour according to the most surveys. By proactive discovering if your Windows machine is infected with malware, is the best way of protection. And this talk aims to empower every user by using a practical tool that is readily available for every anyone and quickly runs. • Old Skool Copy Protection by Aliz HammondAbstract: I will go into detail about how systems from the[masked] era - starting way back at arcade machines - battled counterfeiting by using custom CPUs, self-destructing hardware, and "unusual consequences" for the counterfeiter. Although such historical perspective may seem irrelevant in today's modern world, the simplicity of older computing platforms allows for a clear and unencumbered view of the principles involved. Many of the principles I cover are still used, albeit in refined forms, in modern-day tamper-resistent systems, and I aim to give the motivated viewer enough information to use as a starting block to breaking them. Speaker Bio:Michael RebultanMike has spent more than 15 years as an IT professional, DFIR and ICS/SCADA vulnerability assessor and pen-tester in an Internet Branch Exchange company. Aliz Hammond is a security researcher with side interests in hardware hacking and "old computer stuff". See you there!
events.location: Marina One West Tower, Grab, 9 Straits View, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Capture Every Moment (iPhone & DSLR Photography Workshop)
events.description:
Technology nowadays have changed the way how we do the things that we were so used to do back then, such as taking photos.

Back in the old days, in order for us to shoot a good and high quality photo, we need a good and high cost camera, or a good editing software to enhance the outcome of our master piece. Even if we have all these equipments, still we were not guaranteed that we are able to get the outcome that we expected because there is no guide or simple way for us to get started after investing in such a big amount. 



With technology today, iPhone itself have changed the way how people express themselves and share their story through photography. What if we told you that we are able to show you some of the tips and tricks that you can literally turn your iPhone into a professional photo-shooting tool? What if we can show you some of the rules in photo-shooting that allows you to capture things in a right timing and angle that having the professional outcome? Would be interested to know about them? If yes, this workshop is for you!

In this workshop we will be showing you how you can shoot and edit your photos by using the only iPhone itself, and get a good and professional looking outcome, or if you are into DSLR, we will be sharing some of the basic tips and tricks as well. :)

So don't missed out! See you real soon!
events.location: Switch AEON Mall Bandar Dato’ Onn, Lot F29, First Floor, Aeon Mall Kempas, No. 3, Jalan Dato’Onn, Bandar Dato’Onn,, Johor Bahru 81100
